results.title: Foster's release
results.creator_credit: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions
results.brief_description: A suspenseful drama about a girl who, while babysitting, is the victim of anonymous telephone calls. She tries to have the calls traced. In the taut climax the telephone company and the police work feverishly to reach the girl in time to avert a tragedy. Combines atmospheric music and good use of camera shots including long shots, overhead and close-ups.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions

results.title: Japan: a century of imperialism
results.creator_credit: Gerald Renaud, Irwin Rosten, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Japan: imperial power to industrial giant”.
Using documentary footage, this film traces the rise and fall of Japanese imperialism between the years 1850-1945. It gives insights into Japan’s internal political struggles, its militaristic philosophy, and the role of the United States in providing Japan with the tools of war.

results.title: The Boarded window
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This film is based on the famous horror story by Ambrose Bierce. It tells of a hunter whose young wife dies of fever. Her grief stricken husband prepares her body for burial, but during the night the forces of nature intervene to create a horrific and macabre ending. Restricted : postprimary schools only.

results.title: The Golden deer: a tale of India
results.brief_description: An animated story concerning an Indian princess who dreams of a golden deer and its loovely song. A boy who sets out to win a reward captures the deer, then releases it to save it from hunters and in doing so is given a greater reward.

results.title: The Golden fish
results.creator_credit: Edmond Sechan and Jacques Cousteau Productions
results.brief_description: The story of a young boy who joyfully brings home his new pet. During the boy’s absence, the goldfish leaps out of his bowl, and is confronted by a sinister looking black cat who unexpectedly tosses the fish back into the bowl. Story by Roger Mauge. No dialogue.

results.title: Tawny scrawny lion
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about a scrawny lion who is always hungry and a rabbit who talks the lion out of eating all the other animals of the forest. The rabbit not only befriends the lion but finds a way to satisfy the lion’s hunger. Based on the book of the same title by Kathryn Jackson. Consultant Chuck Jones. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Frank Sandler, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film

results.title: Kayak
results.creator_credit: Bill Snider, Len Aitken and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A non-narrated view of the sport of kayaking. Slow-motion sequences with men and kayaks twisting through rolling rapids and gliding over placid lakes are intercut in this film to capture the excitement and beauty of the sport. The film is not designed to teach skills.

results.title: Pandas: a gift from China
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the two giant pandas presented to the United States in 1972 by China. Records the playful antics of the pandas in their specially designed enclosures at the National Zoological Park in Washington, DC. Also shows the people and jobs that are important to the efficient operation of zoos.

results.title: Whazzat?
results.creator_credit: Art Pierson, Todd Delerman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the East Indian folktale about six blind men who come upon an elephant and attempt to describe it. When each meets and touches the elephant he thinks he has encountered something different. Stresses the moral that cooperating with others can achieve more than working alone. For primary grades.
